messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: If you haven't yet tried the Wednesday Sirloin special, you are truly missing out on a great tasting steak as well as a superb deal.  I have now had two perfect $9.99 Sirloins in a row.  Get it medium rare for maximum flavor and tenderness.  I would avoid the side of "fresh vegetables" which consists of broccoli and carrots.  I think they may be over-cooking these vegetables and not seasoning them at all.  While I appreciate the healthy aspect, they need to have a little more flavor.  My husband loves the baked sweet potato with just a little of the honey cinnamon butter.  The side salads are always good and fresh.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}
Review: Great fun, food and service. Sat in the bar to enjoy a fun happy hour, maybe 2. Jeff provided attentive and engaging service. Try the Tuna Tacos and Truffle Fries.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Steak cooked to perfection or they aim to please.  Managers are aware of customer complaints and exceed expected resolutions. Love the food, love the service, and love the employees professionalism and speed of service.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: We came here for dinner with friends. It was a great night out. We had a great waitress that made for a very pleasant dinning experience. The food was on point and they have one amazingly huge pork chop! My pork chop was the last entree to be placed on our table and everyone lost their minds! This is not a cheap meal for dinner, so you might want to check their lunch specials if you're on a budget.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: Great service, spectacular food and wonderful ambiance ! Had a good time and even a better meal. Daniel was a gentleman and a class act. I can not wait to go back for another delicious meal !!!!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: In town for a speaking responsibility, headed to P.F. Changs for the Lettuce Wraps, great as usual. Great service, excellent quality for the price, if there is a Changes anywhere close when I travel, I'm there!  Only problem is parking @ The Easton Town Center.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: We love their steaks and baked potato dinner.  I tried the porkchop one time and wasn't as happy with it.  But salads, soups, and steaks were fabulous

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: It is great for a romantic night out, or they have ladies night events or taking the kids for dessert.  They do have a happy hour, but you must eat at the bar with your fondue.  I have taken my little girls there several times for just dessert and they think it so neat! However, it can get very pricey, so I would look for a deal.  Signing up for their emails makes you aware of their specials!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Friends and I stopped at the bonefish grill on a Wednesday evening because the bang bang shrimp was a happy hour special. The shrimp was delicious. Two of us got the blackened baja fish tacos, one got the bang bang shrimp tacos and another the fish and chips. Each dinner was very tasty. Our waitress was Nicole B who was very helpful and gave great suggestions on the menu since we were first timers. The only major issue with this place was that it took our entrees a while to come out and the host wasn't very friendly. I would recommend the bonefish grill and look forward to going back.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}
Review: Texas Roadhouse has wonderful steaks and ribs! Always good food and the wait staff are friendly and helpful. This place is always busy but the wait is not long at all.

Review: We walked across the street for dinner because it was close to hotel and had not been to Texas Roadhouse in quite a while, ate at the bar, service was excellent and so was the food especially the roasted chicken, we will return.

Review: Even though it's a steakhouse the pork chop dinner was amazing. There was live piano music in the bar area which created a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The service was great. Definitely worth a try for a quality dinner!!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: Great value for money, excellent food and the servers were fast and very pleasant. we had a relatively large group and yet they managed to bring the food within 30 mins, the children were well looked after and the standard of the steak was outstanding.  Hard to find a better Steak at a franchise!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Went here with a large business group (40+).  We had a private section which was elegant.  They started us with large platters of appetizers and salads.  I really loved the calamari.  We then went on to entree platters of lasagna, chicken parmesan, house pasta with meatballs..I can't remember the last item.  The food was very good.  I skipped dessert.  Great service, great experience.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}
Review: I had a quick bite at the bar and service as well as food was good. Enjoyed the more social bar eating vs alone at a table, had Crab Cakes and they were absolutely good.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: My wife & I went here for our 29th anniversary, and we had a great meal. My Prime Rib was exactly as I ordered, and my wife's Sirloin was perfect! I have been here several times and will definitely be back!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: I have eaten at Bonefish in Camp Hilll numerous times now and have never had anything but exceptional service and food.  For a chain restaurant the atmosphere is sophisticated.  Prices are reasonable and  the portions are substantial.  Always an enjoyable meal and experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: So one of my good girl friends of mine and I went on a Saturday night out to Gulf Coast Town Center. We decided we should eat at P.F. Chang's. In my car on the way, she was telling me about the last time she went to eat here she had a unique drink. Her last boyfriend and her got silly off of this stuff and had a great time. It was called Sake. Apparently the warmer version of Sake is, "better for the body" and so I'm all for it! When we sat down outside, very quickly and it was 8pm, the table was dirty but cleaned and cleared off in a timely manner. So we get to ordering and have us some Sake. We do our cheers, I say "I love this non-pressure situation because were such good friends, so, to a date with a friend!" we both take the shot....and this is what I say. "Michelle, is there supposed to be ice in the warm water?" I stick out my tongue and there was a glass shard about half of the size of a dime. We look inside the little Sake drink and sure enough, a few more pieces of glass in the bottom of the container. I could of been so impacted by the glass if swallowed but my instincts told me it wasn't right to have that object on my tongue. I mean really a piece glass was in my mouth, sharp too, wasn't expecting that kind thing to happen. Anyway, besides almost freakishly choking on glass they gave us 3 more Sake orders for free and the food was fantastic as always. The ordeal was handled great by our waitress. If she didn't act the way she did, I definitely would have sued. But I'm didn't freak out like my friend would have she told me. If I was bleeding then it would have been different because you don't know where that glass came from. We both thought it would be a great story, I can say that's true.   -Sake glass survivor

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Went in for a late lunch on a Saturday and the place was MOBBED, seemed like every local was there LOL. Had a lengthy wait but enjoyed our meal as expected.  The fresh rolls were PIPING hot too. Kind of expected a bigger baked potato but both of our meals were fine as well. Very good service from the staff. Average prices

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Went there last night.   Got great deal. Monday - thursday before 6 pm they have about 6-8 special deals for $11.99.    Same deal that is on other pages for abour $20.   Main entry and 2 sides.  And of course it was very tasteful with good peanuts and cold beer togo with it.  From what i seen. It was best deal in anchorage for the $$$$$$$

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Bit of a wait to get in but the food was worth it. Best blooming onion I've ever tried and the bread is amazing! Sweet with cinamon butter, yummy! Friendly staff with a down to earth atmosphere. Laid back, causal at home feeling.  I'd eat here again and would recommend it to others.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Came with a group of 8; half kids, half adults. We had a great time…  Seated 15 minutes after our reservation. But otherwise only positive things to say.   Service was fast and friendly. Tarek was a good server. Our chef cooked quickly; helpful with kids.   Yummy food and lots of fun.   I don’t understand the bad reviews, at all. Stop complaining about little things and just enjoy.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: I am not usually a fan of chain restaurants like this. We wound up here after being told we'd have a 45-minute wait at another (supposedly more upscale) restaurant nearby by an indifferent hostess, and there were obviously open tables. This being a weeknight, with my group hosting our departing manager for a 'thank you' meal and us having an early start the next morning, we departed and found the Texas Roadhouse just a bit up the road. We were seated immediately after being shown how to visually select our steak from the display cooler. The table was already supplied with a bucket of peanuts. Our waiter arrived quickly and took our beverage orders, then departed. He was back soon with our beverages as well as some delicious and maybe artery-hardening rolls. The restaurant was filling up, so he was delayed a bit in taking our meal orders, but he took them quickly and competently, ensuring that we each knew what our ordered steaks should look like on the inside. He then departed. Those of us who ordered house salads received them quickly. Then we waited - and waited - for our steaks. But, when our main courses arrived, everything was piping hot, and the steaks were all exactly as we had ordered them. EXACTLY! Additionally, although I don't eat much red meat, my steak was very tender and very, very tasty. Reasonably priced, also. It would be hard to convince me that I could have found a better steak, comparably priced, than the one I enjoyed at this Texas Roadhouse. The only reason I marked them down a notch was the time it took to get our meals to us, but maybe I just don't understand. Ruth's Chris has it down to a fine art, but my meal would have cost at least twice what it did here. I would go back to this Texas Roadhouse without hesitation!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: Our recent visit to the Augusta Maine Texas Roadhouse was bitterly disappointing.    I spent a LOT OF $$ on their wonderful rolls -- which was the bulk of my meal because the food was 'that bad' . . .  I had to ASK the waitress as she walked by - for a refill of my drink ---  Waitress NEVER came back to the table to check on the food after it was delivered.  How does a steak restaurant mess up on a cheeseburger - I will never know.  Believe the 'Hostess' was going around to 'some' tables - asking customers how their meals were --- but did not appear she was interested in visiting the section of the restaurant I was in.    I tipped just over 10% when my norm is at least 20% or larger --- just because I felt guilty of tipping less --- even though the food/serve was that bad.    My insult was the tab ---  wonder is anyone would 'get the hint' by the amount of food left behind on the plate.  As I said - the rolls were my dinner .. .!!!!

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: We turned up last night  to celebrate our wedding anniversary , having not made a reservation we were given a table and told that our waiter James would be our server. We sat there for 15 minutes watching other people being taken to their table/booths and orders for drinks and food being taken, the waiters seemed clueless and we didn’t appreciate being ignored, not once did any of the so called waiters attend our table to take at least an order for drinks. When we decided to walk out the hostess said I’m sorry, so we’re we, probably the worst restaurant for service we have visited, take a tip keep away😡😡😡😡

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: My wife and i went with two friends. The atmosphere was harried and  very noisy. Waiters  were running helter skelter, staff shouting etc. I asked for a quiet table and the response was "we have no quiet tables, listen"--true. Our waiter gave us the distinct impression that we were unimportant $$..First he said the advertised special was unavailable at the price, second he got the number of pre ordered lobsters wrong, and thirdly indicated later on that they were "not pushing" souffles because they take 45 minutes to prepare. So,maybe for those prices, ask at the beginning of the meal. We literally could not get the attention of our or other waiters other than standing up.The bill was wrong--all a la carte prices. I went to two managers and the bill was very rudely adjusted. The manger explained, in a very rushed tone, that he had already run the unsigned charges and ran another charge with the proper charges, but refused to provide me with any cancelled or voided receipt.He , as others , were basically rude, but eventually got it right.. Our Lobsters were not warm and  were semi digested, and the steaks were dry and not of prime quality The table next to us returned theirs..What a mess@! So if you are looking for  quiet place, attentive service and good steaks and seafood , definitely try another place. Leave this to the drinkers and shouters and those that abide corporate restaurant culture.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: I'm a self-appointed filet snob and have to hand it to these guys, they do a very, very good job on a filet. Not quite up to Firebirds, but not up to their prices either, definitely worth going. Their loaded baked potato is award winning, and it's hard not to fill right up on the complimentary rolls & butter and in-shell peanuts. Neat log cabin style atmosphere, though certainly not the place I'd come for a special occasion, imho, just a little too, I dunno, Kmart-ish if that makes any sense.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: I had a great night, huge portions of food, lively atmosphere, perfect beer... an all American experience! Would recommend the loaded fries! So good! The waitress was attentive and the service was fast. Thanks for an awesome night.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: Casper seems to be the land of chains, so we decided to hit Texas Roadhouse for a good steak.  We were not disappointed with the standard Texas Roadhouse fair and bonus that they served some local Wyoming beer on tap.  The servers were extremely friendly and accomodating.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: We got in to our hotel late and this place was next door so we gave it a try. We were very disappointed. If we’re going to pay over $200 for 2 people to eat it needs to be good and it wasn’t. The place was less than 1/3 full when we arrived. Our server had 3 tables. So, you’d think the service would be excellent. It was not. Our drinks took at least 15 mins to get, we waited another 15 mins to order food, and we just felt ignored. My wife had a steak - very average, I had a fish- very average, and the best part of the meal was the mash potatoes. One bright spot- the manager made a point to say “hi” to every guest which is always nice. Overall, we can’t recommend this place. There’s probably 100 good restaurants in Nashville but this is not one of them.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: I had lunch with my husband here. I got an awesome piece of grouper and coleslaw, terrific. The restaurant wasn't busy at all but our server didn't come around very much.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: I had the steak & shrimp, loaded bake potato & a dinner salad. It was good and this North Carolina location was consistent with the four Texas Roadhouses in Colorado, and the one in Utah, I have been to. I like Texas Roadhouse when traveling for business as I can have a meal and get in & out quickly. Service was good.

Review: Excellent service, quiet romantic ambience, and wonderful Italian food. I had the shrimp carbonara, tasty shrimp with authentic carbonara sauce. They’re always happy to provide substitutions or additions. The Italian bread is fresh with oil and balsamic vinegar so welcoming.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: I was born and raised in Argentina, and I lived in Brazil and this intro is to explain how good I feel in Chama Gaucha. The food incredible, the environment perfect and the service superb, and if you have a chance to meet the owner ... be prepared he will surprise you with food that you never eat.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: The worst.  Steak I've ever had.   The cooks definitely need to be retrained  I used to love coming to this restaurant for a nice steak.   I asked for medium steak. And they brought me road kill   Wow   How disappointing   The ribs where dried.  Like I was trying to eat jerky   Wow. How disappointing!!   Destroyed the name of Texas road house.   Sadly the worst steak house in all of Utah

Review: We ordered a large pizza with everything. Thin crispy, fresh and very good. The owner came out and gave my granddaughter pizza dough to play with and she had the best time.  The restaurant is cute and very Italian. The staff were super nice and we received excellent service.  The glass case in front had all kinds of Italian desserts.  I visit Dallas area often and this will be my first stop next time. Excellent value for the money.

Review: We are typically not chain restaurant people. But we always make an exception for the Bonefish.  While Bang Bang shrimp is the go to appetizer we always have them make their original "saucy shrimp" for us. Amazing. Try it!!   Love sitting in the bar area and conversing with other patrons. Their drinks are very well made and we always have a delicious, consistently well prepared meal here.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: We went on a Sunday night (with reservations) to celebrate our 31st anniversary.  They asked us right away if we were celebrating something and I understood quickly why this was a special occasion restaurant.  It is much more than a meal; it is an experience and my husband and I loved every minute of it.  We shared the four course dinner for 2 and it all tasted wonderful.  If we ran out a particular item, our server was quick to bring us more.  Our dessert included a glass of wine each for a sweet anniversary toast. To say we left fully sated is an understatement.  The service was top notch.  Thank you Savannah for making it a wonderful night for us.

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:

Review: I visited here on friday the 21st of June for my birthday!!! it was Three of us the service was good the food was very tasty We all had the shrimp &scallops with different sauces, along with veggies and potatoes!! Also we had some lemon drops and  it was very good  !!   The bread was hot!! This is what good service is!!! Also they gave me a gift of candy for my brthday... This was a nice touch!!

Review: Texas Roadhouse is pretty much the same everywhere and this one is good but my issue was that I was there around 6:15 and on a wednesday night and when I ordered prime rib they came back and said they ran out. It was actually the only reason I was there so I couldn't believe it. They told me they only cook 13 lbs a day during the week and they had many orders earlier in the day. Anyway get there early of you want prime rib.

Review: We love this restaurant.  Usually, we prefer a more upscale restaurant, but for a frequent go to place this checks all the boxes.  The food is great; drinks are generous and the service is very good.

Review: Best steak in the areas. Even wet back for a second time. Even when wrong steak was brought to the table, staff quickly brought the correct one. Try T-bone had both types. Tip ask steak to be cooked after starter is finished

You are a helpful assistant that analyzes customer reviews. For each review, return the sentiment (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) and a short topic label (1-5 words) in this JSON format:
{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: We had another outstanding experience at Cooper's Hawk. We were a group of three ladies, celebrating a birthday at lunch. As always, the food was scrumptious. I had the Blackened Bleu Skirt Steak Salad and it was so yummy. It's the third time I'd had that particular dish. The steak was done perfectly to order (med rare) and the salad was crispy and fresh. The dressing was to die for! My sister ordered the Braised Short Rib Grilled Cheese sandwich with tomato soup. She said it was fab. Our other guest had a salad, but I forgot which one. She, too, said her meal was excellent. As much as we love CH wines, two of us had the Cooper's Hawk Bloody Mary. OMG, they are soooo good! The Bloody Mary comes with so much garnish it's like getting a free appetizer, and it also comes with a side of beer (about 2 oz, I think).   Our server, Erica, was gracious, friendly and knowledgeable. Even with her mask on, we could tell that she smiled constantly while serving us. She's an excellent server and I mentioned this to the management on our way out.  I highly recommend CH for lunch or dinner, any day of the week. It's a great place for an intimate date night or an animated afternoon or evening with a group of friends.

Review: My mother-in-law there wanted to go there for her 89th birthday. We were seated right off. We got quick and attentive service. My mother-in-law's steak wasn't cooked to her satisfaction. The waitress immediately took it back. The manager stopped by to apologize and said they were preparing a new one. The manager then brought out the new one, made sure it met her satisfaction, and chatted for a couple minutes. They staff wished her a happy birthday after we finished. She was quite happy with her dinner.   I've seen complaints about the noise. Yes, it is noisy, but it is supposed to be a honky tonk environment, so what do you expect?

Review: My wife and I went to the Texas Roadhouse in early February to beat the doldrums of our once-in-a hundred year’s winter and we were very pleased.  They have trained their staff well to please the customer (my wife was a former server) and the steak was cooked exactly as we asked it.  I like medium.  My wife liked medium-well, and it was served as the epitome of those definitions.  The portions were large with a variety of sides and add-on options to choose from.  We were not disappointed in any way and came away with leftovers for the next day.  Rochester needed a true steakhouse.  This is it. On the point of cost:  The prices are on par with other restaurants in the area, including The Outback, Hubble House etc.  I feel that the steak was prepared in a better way, better cuts, no gristle – a real good steak for a steak price.  The consumer gets what he pays for here.  The bill could grow large if a whole family were brought, but if one watches what he drinks and looks at the menu, there isn’t a better made steak for the money in town.  By the way, the servers do a line-step dance about once every hour.  Cute, and adds to the atmosphere.    If you bring kids, prepare to pay.  I'm not sure my picky-eating son (8) would have liked much and my daughter (10) would have appreciated the meal for the price.

Review: This was my second trip to this fine restaurant.  Four of us ate there on a Wednesday night.  Service was not as good as my last visit but it was good.  Our waiter made lots of mistakes and one of my quest had to ask 3 times for water with lemon in it.  Food quality was excellent.  I had the Sockeye Salmon and it was excellent.  The vegetable side was very good.  This was a special menu item that night and is strongly recommended.  Waiter brought the wrong wine to the table but we stopped him before he opened the white when we ordered a red wine.  And guess what, that wine was on our tab with the other bottle.  Sloppy service.  Overall I like this restaurant and our out of town guest loved it.  The wife is ready to eat at Bonefish Grill any day.  She loves the lobster.

{"sentiment": "...", "topic": "..."}

Review: This Benihana location continues to go downhill.  We used to look forward to a trip to Benihanas, but now, each yearly visit reminds us why we don't go there much anymore.  If I do go, I will no longer order scallops or lobster as you take your chances on whether the cook will be able to cook them properly.  After paying so much for a lobster tail, it's very disappointing to find it inedible. Mine was burnt and so overdone that I literally couldn't eat it. It was like rubber. My scallops were barely edible. They were black on the outside and slightly underdone in the middle.  If you are going to order seafood, stick with shrimp as they never seem to ruin that.   When another diner at my table asked that their steak be cooked a bit more as it was not what they ordered, the chef argued with them about it, claiming it was cooked medium as they ordered it.  The diner felt that it was too rare.  Regardless of the chef's opinion, he should have just listened to the diner and put it back on the grill.  Our chef also missed the shrimp on one diner's order and had to ask for more to be brought.  Service by the servers is also usually poor. The bathrooms were dirty with toilet paper on the floor.   When I called to make a reservation, the person on the phone was snarky.  "Well, we only make reservations over an hour in advance, but we have room today so I'll do it for you this time."   While this may be their reservation policy, they could have communicated it politely. Imagine a very snarky voice who was doing me a big favor by taking my reservation.   It's a shame this location is so poorly run as Benihanas has been a favorite place of ours for a long time, but Short Hills is the worst location I've seen.

Review: Un restaurant au service typiquement japonais, bien qu'un peu plus excentrique que du classique avec des jongleries qui ne se limitent pas seulement aux instruments de cuisine. Les cuisiniers ont leur style et leurs petits cachets personnels tout en étant cependant formés à la "même école", donc pas de crainte si ce n'est pas un Japonais de "pure souche" qui fera votre repas, la différence se fait au niveau de l'humour de chacun car l'habileté est leur "maître mot". Cuisine excellente, légère tout en étant suffisamment copieuse. Attention de ne pas poser vos affaires au sol, proche de l'aération de la table de cuisson: expérience faite, mon sac sentait la cuisson des crevettes pendant plusieurs jours.

Review: After a full day of traveling, I stopped in to this establishment for a simple meal.   Upon arriving at the hostess station,  it was very apparent that the team was having a challenging interaction with another customer.   After being seated, I placed my order. The meal arrived and it's visual display was disappointing. The asparagus was way over done.  The menu stated 'steamed'.  I ordered my steak medium and it was medium rare at best.   The staff seemed unprepared and a novice at customer service. Observing the environment in the entire restaurant, presenting an issue was an act in futility. It appeared that there were at least three members of leadership on duty and not one of them checked to see how my meal was.  This was a Monday night and the restaurant was maybe at 50 percent capacity.   Sad situation.

Review: We've never been disappointed with our ( limited ) experience with Bonefish ( mostly Columbus, OH).  This location in Bonita Springs was no different.  Here's the thing:  with so many local restaurants serving fish in the area, you would think that Bonefish might not compete.  Not true.  Our fish was better than several of the locals.  Plus we brought a party of seven people.  They seated us and served us promptly.  Several of us enjoyed the special:  a lobster and crab stuffed shrimp.  It was simply delicious.  The bang bang shrimp appetizer was likewise with just the right tang to it. So we confirmed that Bonefish is an excellent choice no matter the location.

Review: TOTAL disappointment....well...almost...okay....waited an extra at least 20 minutes (more if I didn't check my place in the line) because THEY SKIPPED US and TOTALLY FORGOTTEN ABOUT US! It took them a LONG time to get us our main course, but the steak has to be done twice as the first time was done medium-well when we asked for medium-rare...the "famous fall-of-the-bone rip"...well, yes, they literally fall-of-the-bone, but it was also very dry...it was overcooked.... =.= The appetizer was good, and so was our server...at least that saved the day....when we left....none of the four greeters thank us for our business even though they were not busy AT ALL....

Review: We had the pleasure to go to Morton’s Steakhouse in Great Neck for restaurant week ($29.95) for my birthday yesterday (Nov. 9, 2018). The food was luscious (Caesar salad, filet Mignon, mashed potatoes, key lime pie) and cooked to perfection. The staff were top notch and catered to our every whim. They even provided took a picture of us and framed it in a Morton’s picture frame as a birthday memory. They also provide a candle for my birthday dessert. Felt soooo pampered due to the superb staff of Morton’s and upscale, cooked to perfection food. Thank you Morton’s for making my birthday a memorable one.

Review: I haven't eaten at a Bonefish in a long time (several years) but was pleasantly surprised with the good gluten free menu and fresh food. I had specifically asked for a gluten free menu and ordered off of it and didn't think I needed to specify that I needed the cilantro lime shrimp salad prepared gluten free (just without the tortilla strips) but our waiter obviously didn't pick up on or know enough about a GF diet to be concerned and brought it with the tortilla strips. Thankfully, I do not have celiac disease and was able to pick them all out. Our waiter didn't seem to be thrilled to be working until he gave his last "great to have you tonight" as I went to leave the tip, but we didn't let him ruin our dinner. ;) I ordered the cilantro lime shrimp salad as stated which was very tasty and my husband ordered the corn/crab chowder and ahi tuna sashimi. He really enjoyed his as well. We'll have to try the one in our hometown soon.

Review: Have not been to Bonefish since COVID, so several years ago. My friends and I were seated at a booth that had torn upholstery.  So first impression - not good!!!!    I saw grilled swordfish on the menu as a special.   I think it was priced around $20-25.  It was offered with a crabmeat topping option but I ordered the plain grilled with lemon butter sauce on the side.  The meal came with 2 sides.  I chose mashed potatoes and green beans.  The piece of fish I received tasted good but it was no larger than a deck of cards. For the price I was expecting more.  I wish I had taken a picture.  Also ordered a vodka martini which was small and very weak.  However, the service was very good. Our server did a good job.  But  I don't know how this place stays in business with high prices and small portions.  I will not be returning anytime soon.

Review: Met with some friends here for dinner. Food was delicious. Came out of kitchen pipping hot! Our server was extremely attentive. Saw glasses half full and immediately brought us new ones. Not rushed out when done even though they were crowded and had a line. Will definitely return there in the future!

Review: Our server was Ashley and she was awesome! Took care of our every need. The atmosphere was inviting and cozy. Salads, sweet potatoes and steaks are were tasty. Food was hot, arrived timely and was filling for the long flight ahead.Enjoyed our experience thank you!!

Review: Texas Roadhouse is a "go to" when traveling because we can usually please all parties and are familiar with the menu.  This location was very good.....we had really great service, but the food was just beyond average.  Not as good as the location at home, but better than others I have visited on the road.  It will be worth visiting again if in the area.

Review: I went there with a group of friends for NYE dinner. Our reservation was at 7:30 but we arrived around 7:00 to grab a drink at the bar. I went to the hostess stand at 7:30 to see if our table was ready and I was told they would come and get us in two minutes. I continued to be told that for the next 20 minutes. I finally told the hostess that I wanted a real estimate because we'd been told two minutes for a while. She apologized and we ended up being seated a few minutes later. To make up for our wait, they gave us complimentary appetizers which were excellent. I would have much rather been told up front that our table wasn't ready the first time. Other than the wait, the food and service were excellent. I usually always get dessert but since we were sat 20 minutes late and had a car service coming later I didn't have time. It was a little pricy but very good food. I would recommend it but be prepared to wait.

Review: open late for visitors arriving after 8 at TIA  Great Italian food to impress visitors and for a great meal.  Big servings - delicious bread --no need for a salad.
